entry.title: 量子化学中使用的近似方法
entry.content:
Chapter 5 of ‘量子化学_mooc_NJU’

大多数原子和分子的薛定谔方程无法精确求解，因此发展了若干近似求解方法。

  1. Variational Method

  2. Linear Variational Principle and Secular Determinant

  3. Perturbation Theory and its Applications

1 Variational Method变分方法

Given a trial wave function试探波函数 $\varphi$,then:
$$E_\varphi = rac{\int \varphi^* \hat{H} \varphi d au}{\int \varphi^* \varphi d au} \geq \varepsilon_0$$
$\varepsilon_0$: 体系的精确基态能量

If a trial function $\psi$ depends on some parameters, $\alpha, eta,\gamma,…$, then:
$$E_\varphi(\alpha, eta,\gamma,…) \geq \varepsilon_0$$
Now we can minimize $E_\varphi$ with respect to variational parameters to get the best possible ground-state energy.

Example: The ground state of a hydrogen atom

$$\hat{H} = - rac{\hbar^2}{2m_e r^2} rac{d}{dr}(r^2 rac{d}{dr})- rac{e^2}{4\pi \varepsilon_0 r}$$
Try a Gaussian function$\varphi(r)=e^{-ar^2}$ as a trial function, $\alpha$ being a variational parameter变分参数

$$E(\alpha)= rac{3\hbar^2 \alpha}{2m_e}- rac{e^2 \alpha^{1/2}}{\sqrt{2}\varepsilon_0 \pi^{3/2}}$$
求$E$的最小值:
$$ rac{dE(\alpha)}{d\alpha}=0 \Rightarrow \alpha= rac{m_e^2 e^4}{18\pi^3 \varepsilon_0^2 \hbar^4}$$
$$E_{min}=- rac{4}{3\pi}( rac{m_e e^4}{16\pi^2 \varepsilon_0^2 \hbar^2}) > - rac{1}{2}( rac{m_e e^4}{16\pi^2 \varepsilon_0^2 \hbar^2})=\varepsilon_0$$

Exact wave function:
$$\psi_0(r, heta,\varphi)= rac{1}{\sqrt{\pi}} a^{-3/2} e^{-r/a_0} \qquad \varepsilon_0=- rac{1}{2}( rac{m_e e^4}{16\pi^2 \varepsilon_0^2 \hbar^2})$$
Variational wave function:
$$\varphi_0(r, heta,\varphi)= rac{8}{3^{3/2}\pi} rac{1}{\sqrt{\pi a_0^3}} e^{-(8/9\pi)r^2/a_0^2} \qquad E_0=- rac{4}{3\pi}( rac{m_e e^4}{16\pi^2 \varepsilon_0^2 \hbar^2})$$

Example: Harmonic oscillator简谐振子

$$\hat{H}=- rac{\hbar^2}{2\mu} rac{d^2}{dx^2}+ rac{1}{2}kx^2$$
Try a function$\varphi=\cos \lambda x$ as a trial function, $\lambda$ being a variational parameter变分参数

$$E(\lambda)= rac{\hbar^2 \lambda^2}{2\mu}+( rac{\pi^2}{24}- rac{1}{4}) rac{k}{\lambda^2}$$

$$E_{min}(\lambda)=( rac{\pi^2}{3}-2)^{1/2} rac{\hbar}{2} ( rac{k}{\mu})^{1/2} =(1.14) rac{1}{2}\hbar\omega > rac{1}{2}\hbar\omega=\varepsilon_0$$

Allocation of the Variational Method to Two-electron Problems

The Hamiltonian operator for $He$:

$$\hat{H}=(- rac{\hbar^2}{2 m_e} abla_1^{2} - rac{2 e^2}{4 \pi \varepsilon_0} rac{1}{r_1}) + (- rac{\hbar^2}{2 m_e} abla_2^{2}- rac{2 e^2}{4 \pi \varepsilon_0} rac{1}{r_2}) + rac{e^2}{4 \pi \varepsilon_0} \cdot rac{1}{r _{12}} $$
$$= \hat{H} _H(1)+\hat{H} _H(2)+ rac{e^{2}}{4 \pi \varepsilon_0} \cdot rac{1}{r _{12}}$$

量子力学基本假设antisymmetric： 对于该体系，交换两个电子的坐标，其波函数要取负值(反对称):$\Psi(x_1,x_2)=-\Psi(x_2,x_1)$

For $He$, its trial wave function must be antisymmetric about exchange of two electrons 1 and 2, $Z$ being a variational parameter变分参数:
$$\Psi_{0}(x_1, x_2)=\varphi_{0}(\vec{r}_1, \vec{r}_2) \Omega(\sigma_1, \sigma_2)$$

$$\varphi_0 (\vec{r_1}, \vec{r_2}) =\psi_{1s}(\vec{r_1}) \psi_{1s}(\vec{r_2}) \quad \Omega(\sigma_1, \sigma_2)= rac{1}{\sqrt{2}}[\alpha(\sigma_1) eta(\sigma_2)- eta(\sigma_1) \alpha(\sigma_2)]$$

$$\psi_{1s}(\vec{r}_j)=( rac{Z^3}{\pi a_0^3})^{1/2} e^{Zr_j/a_0} \qquad j=1or2$$

Try the trial function:
$$E(Z)= rac{m_e e^4}{16 \pi^2 \varepsilon_{0}^{2} \hbar^2}(Z^2- rac{27}{8} Z)$$
$$ rac{dE}{dZ}=0 \Rightarrow Z_{min}= rac{27}{16} \quad E_{min}=-( rac{27}{16})^2=-2.8477$$
from experimental: $\varepsilon_0=-2.9033$
in units of $ rac{m_e e^4}{16 \pi^2 \varepsilon_{0}^{2} \hbar^2}$

有效核电荷$Z= rac{27}{16} < 2$ : 两个电子之间的屏蔽作用

2 Linear Variational Principle线性变分方法 and Secular Determianant久期行列式

For a arbitrary任意的 wave function $| \phi >$, suppose it can be expanded as:
$$|\phi > =\sum\limits_{i=1}^N c_i |\psi > $$
where $|\psi >$ is a fixed set of $N$ basis functions.

Assume that the basis functions are real:
$$< \phi|\phi > = |\phi > =\sum\limits_{ij}c_i c_j < \psi_i|\psi_j >=\sum\limits_{ij}c_i c_j S_{ij}$$
$$< \phi|\hat{H}|\phi > = |\phi > =\sum\limits_{ij}c_i c_j < \psi_i|\hat{H}|\psi_j >=\sum\limits_{ij}c_i c_j H_{ij}$$
$H$ 和 $S$为对称矩阵：
$$ < \psi_i|\hat{H}|\psi_j > = H_{ij}= H_{ji} \qquad < \psi_i|\psi_j > = S_{ij}= S_{ji}$$

$$E= rac{< \phi|\phi >}{< \phi|\hat{H}|\phi >}= rac{\sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^N c_i c_j H_{ij}}{\sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^N c_i c_j S_{ij}}$$

To solve:
$$\sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^N c_i c_j H_{ij}=E\sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^N c_i c_j S_{ij}$$
之后两侧同时对$c_\kappa$求导

To get the minimum energy $E$, we must have:
$$ rac{\partial E}{\partial c_\kappa}=0 \quad (\kappa=1,2,…,N)$$

It is easy to prove the relationship:$\partial E / \partial c_\kappa=\delta_{i\kappa}$, ($\delta_{i\kappa}=0$ if $i=\kappa$, $\delta_{i\kappa}=1$ else)

Therefore:
$$\sum\limits_{i=1}^N c_i H_{i\kappa}+\sum\limits_{j=1}^N c_j H_{\kappa j}=E(\sum\limits_{i=1}^N c_i S_{i\kappa}+\sum\limits_{j=1}^N c_j S_{\kappa j})$$

With the relationship $H_{ij}= H_{ji}$, $S_{ij}= S_{ji}$, the above equation can be simplified as:
$$\sum\limits_{i=1}^N c_i H_{i\kappa}==E\sum\limits_{i=1}^N c_i S_{i\kappa}$$

Therefore:
$$\sum\limits_{i=1}^N (H_{i\kappa}-ES_{i\kappa})c_i=0, \quad (\kappa=1,2,…,N)$$

To have a nontrivial solution, the following Secular Determianant must be equal to $0$:
$$
\left| egin{array}{cccc}
H_{11}-E S_{11} & H_{12}-E S_{12} & \cdots & H_{1 N}-E S_{1 N} \
H_{12}-E S_{12} & H_{22}-E S_{22} & \cdots & H_{2 N}-E S_{2 N} \
\vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \
H_{1 N}-E S_{1 N} & H_{2 N}-E S_{2 N} & \cdots & H_{N N}-E S_{N N}
\end{array} ight|=0
$$

By expanding this determinant, one obtains a Nth-order N阶 secular equation久期方程, which can be solved to get $N$ roots for $E$.
The smallest root corresponds to the ground-state energy.

Example

Determine the normalized trial function for a variational treatment of a particle in a box求解箱中粒子的试探波函数
$$\varphi=c_1x(1-x)+c_2x^2(1-x)^2 \quad (0 \leq x \leq 1)$$

SOLUTION:
The eogenvalues can be obtained by solving the equation below:
$$
\left| egin{array}{ll}
H_{11}-E S_{11} & H_{12}-E S_{12} \
H_{12}-E S_{12} & H_{22}-E S_{22}
\end{array} ight|=0
$$

$$H_{11}=\int_0^1 x(1-x) \hat{H} x(1-x)dx=\int_0^1 x(1-x)[- rac{\hbar^2}{2m} rac{d^2}{dx^2}x(1-x)]dx= rac{\hbar^2}{6m}$$
$$H_{12}= rac{\hbar^2}{30m} \qquad H_{22}= rac{\hbar^2}{105m}$$
$$S_{11}= rac{1}{30} \qquad S_{12}= rac{1}{140} \qquad S_{22}= rac{1}{630}$$

The correspongding equation becomes:
$$E’^2-56E’+252=0 (E’=mE/\hbar^2)$$
$$E_{min}=4.93487 rac{\hbar^2}{m}$$

Back to the first equation:
$$
\left( egin{array}{ll}
H_{11}-E_{\min } S_{11} & H_{12}-E_{\min } S_{12} \
H_{12}-E_{\min } S_{12} & H_{22}-E_{\min } S_{22}
\end{array} ight)\left( egin{array}{c}
c_{1} \
c_{2}
\end{array} ight)=0
$$
These two equation are not independent of each other, so we solve only one, and get:
$$ rac{c_2}{c_1}=1.133$$
With the normalization condition:$\int \varphi^2(x)dx=1$ the normalized trial funtion corresponding to $E_{min} is$:
$$\varphi=4.404x(1-x)+4.990x^2(1-x)^2$$

The exact ground-state particle in a box wave function:
$$\psi_1(x)=2^{1/2}\sin \pi x$$

Another Situation

It is commom partice to use a trial function of the form:
$$\varphi=\sum\limits_{j=1}^N c_j f_j$$
The $f_j$ themselves may also contain variational parameters. $f_j$本身包含参数

An example of such a trial funcion for the hydrogen atom is:
$$\varphi=\sum\limits_{j=1}^N c_j e^{-\alpha_j r^2}$$
The $\mathbf{c_j}$ and the $\mathbf{\alpha_j}$ are treated as variational paramenters变分参数.

A number of optimization methods can be used to obtain the optimal $2N$ paramenters and the ground-state energy.

The exact value(-0.500) is approached as $N$ increase.

3 Perturbation Theory 微扰理论

Suppose we wish to solve the eigenvalue problem:
$$H|\psi_i angle =E_i|\psi_i angle $$
Let:
$$H=H_0+ u$$
$H_0$: Zeroth-order Hamiltonian零级哈密顿
$ u$: perturbation微扰项

Where wo know the eigenfunctions and eigenvalue of $H_0$:
$$H_0|\psi_i^{(0)} angle =E_i^{(0)}|\psi_i^{(0)} angle$$

How to select $ u$：the perturbation $ u$ should be small.

定义函数：
$$H(\lambda)=H_0+\lambda u$$
对其本征值$E_i(\lambda)$进行泰勒展开：
$$E_i(\lambda)=E_i^{(0)}+\lambda E_i^{(1)}+\lambda^2 E_i^{(2)}+…$$
其波函数也可以进行泰勒展开：
$$|\psi_i angle (\lambda)=|\psi_{i}^{(0)} angle+\lambda|\psi_{i}^{(1)} angle+\lambda^2|\psi_{i}^{(2)} angle+…$$

$E_i^{(n)}$: The $n$th-order correction
$\psi_i^{(n)}$: The $n$th-order wave function

Let $|i angle=|\psi_i^{(0)} angle$ and assume the intermediate normalization for $|\psi_i angle$中间归一化:
$$\langle i|\psi_i angle=\langle i|i angle + \lambda\langle i|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+…=1$$
Thus:
$$\langle i|\psi_i^{(n)} angle =0 \qquad n=1,2,3,…$$

Substituting the expression of $H(\lambda)$,$E_i(\lambda)$ and $|\psi_i angle (\lambda)$ into the schrodinger equation:
$$(H_{0}+\lambda u)\left(|i angle+\lambda|\psi_{i}^{(1)} angle+\lambda^{2}|\psi_{i}^{(2)} angle+… ight)=\left(E_{i}^{(0)}+\lambda E_{i}^{(1)}+\lambda^{2} E_{i}^{(2)}+… ight)\left(|i angle+\lambda|\psi_{i}^{(1)} angle+… ight)$$

展开后，当且仅当$\lambda^n$各个次方项的系数相等才能使得方程成立：
$$n=0 \qquad H_0|i angle =E_i^{(0)}|i angle \qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\quad$$
$$n=1 \qquad H_0|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+ u|i angle=E_i^{(0)}|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+E_i^{(1)}|i angle$$
$$\quad\qquad\qquad \qquad n=2 \qquad H_0|\psi_i^{(2)} angle+ u|\psi_i^{(1)} angle=E_i^{(0)}|\psi_i^{(2)} angle+E_i^{(1)}|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+E_i^{(2)}|i angle$$
$$… \qquad\qquad … \qquad\qquad …$$

For a Hermitian operator:
$$\left\langle i|H_0|\psi_i^{(n)} ight angle=E_i^{(0)}\left\langle i|\psi_i^{(n)} ight angle=0 \qquad n=1,2,… \qquad \left(\langle f|\hat{A}|g angle=\langle \hat{A}f|g angle ight)$$

Multiplying each of these equations by $\langle i|$ and using the orthogonality relation:
$$E_i^{(0)}=\langle i|H_0|i angle$$
$$E_i^{(1)}=\langle i| u|i angle \quad$$
$$E_i^{(2)}=\langle i| u|\psi_i^{(1)} angle$$
$$E_i^{(3)}=\langle i| u|\psi_i^{(2)} angle$$
$$… \qquad …$$

For example, let us start with the equation for $n=1$
$$H_0|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+ u|i angle=E_i^{(0)}|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+E_i^{(1)}|i angle$$

Multiplying this equations by $\langle i|$:
$$\langle i|H_0|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+ \langle i| u|i angle=\langle i|E_i^{(0)}|\psi_i^{(1)} angle+\langle i|E_i^{(1)}|i angle$$

We can derive:
$$E_i^{(1)}=\langle i| u|i angle=\langle \psi_i^{(0)}| u|\psi_i^{(0)} angle$$

By setting $\lambda=1$, we have:
$$H=H_0+ u$$
$$E_i=E_i^{(0)}+\lambda E_i^{(1)}+\lambda^2 E_i^{(2)}+…$$
$$|\psi_i angle=|\psi_{i}^{(0)} angle+\lambda|\psi_{i}^{(1)} angle+\lambda^2|\psi_{i}^{(2)} angle+…$$

$$\psi_i=\psi_i^{(0)}+\psi_i^{(1)}+\psi_i^{(2)}+…$$
The first-order correction ($\psi_i^{(1)}$) is still quite substantial相当可观

First-order perturbation theory

(1) The first-order energy

$$E_i^{(0)}=\langle i|H_0|i angle=\langle \psi_i^{(0)}|H_0|\psi_i^{(0)} angle$$
$$E_i^{(1)}=\langle \psi_i^{(0)}| u|\psi_i^{(0)} angle$$
$$E_i=E_i^{(0)}+E_i^{(1)}=\langle \psi_i^{(0)}|H_0|\psi_i^{(0)} angle+\langle \psi_i^{(0)}| u|\psi_i^{(0)} angle=\langle \psi_i^{(0)}|H|\psi_i^{(0)} angle$$
The first-order energy can be obtained with the zero-order wave function

(2) The second-order energy

In the case $n=1$:
$$(E_i^{(0)}-H_0)|\psi_i^{(1)} angle=( u-E_i^{(1)})|i angle$$
Multiplying both side by $\langle n |$:
$$\langle n |(E_i^{(0)}-H_0)|\psi_i^{(1)} angle=\langle n |( u-E_i^{(1)})|i angle=\langle n | u|i angle \quad (n eq i)$$

Expanding the first-order wave function is terms of the eigenfunction of $H_0$, one gets一级波函数展开为零级哈密顿的所有本征函数线性组合:
$$|\psi_i^{(1)} angle={\sum\limits_m}’ |m angle C_m^{(1)} \quad (m eq i)$$
So:
$$\langle n |(E_i^{(0)}-H_0){\sum\limits_m}’ |m angle C_m^{(1)} \quad (m eq i) angle =(E_i^{(0)}-E_n^{(0)})C_n^{(1)}$$
$$C_n^{(1)}= rac{\langle n | u|i angle}{E_i^{(0)}-E_n^{(0)}}$$

The first-order wave function:
$$|\psi_i^{(1)} angle={\sum\limits_n}’ |n angle rac{\langle n | u|i angle}{E_i^{(0)}-E_n^{(0)}} \quad (n eq i)$$

$$E_i^{(2)}=\langle i| u|\psi_i^{(1)} angle={\sum\limits_n}’ \langle i| u|n angle rac{\langle n | u|i angle}{E_i^{(0)}-E_n^{(0)}}=\langle i| u|\psi_i^{(1)} angle={\sum\limits_n}’ rac{\langle i| u|n angle \langle n | u|i angle}{E_i^{(0)}-E_n^{(0)}}$$

$$E_i=E_i^{(0)}+E_i^{(1)}+E_i^{(2)}=\left\langle \psi_i^{(0)} | H | \psi_i^{(0)} ight angle+ E_i^{(2)}$$

Application of Perturbation Theory to the Helium Atom

The Hamiltonian operator of $He$:
$$\hat{H} = \hat{H_H}(1) + \hat{H_H}(2) + rac{e^2}{4\pi \varepsilon_0} rac{1}{r_{12}} \qquad \hat{H_H} (i)=- rac{\hbar^2}{2m_e} abla_i^2- rac{2e^2}{4\pi \varepsilon_0} rac{1}{r_i}\quad (i=1,2)$$

$$H _0 = \hat{H _H}(1) + \hat{H _H}(2) \qquad u= rac{e^2}{4\pi \varepsilon_0} rac{1}{r _{12}}$$

The zero-order wave function (of two zero-order Hamilton) are(空间部分×自旋部分):
$$\Psi_k^{(0)}=\varphi_k(\mathbf{r_1},\mathbf{r_2}) \Omega(\sigma_1,\sigma_2)$$
$$\Omega(\sigma_1,\sigma_2)= rac{1}{\sqrt{2}}[\alpha(\sigma_1) eta(\sigma_2)- eta(\sigma_1)\alpha(\sigma_2)]$$
$$\varphi_k(\mathbf{r_1},\mathbf{r_2})= rac{1}{\sqrt{2}}[\psi_{nlm}(\mathbf{r_1})\psi_{n’l’m’}(\mathbf{r_2})+\psi_{nlm}(\mathbf{r_2})\psi_{n’l’m’}(\mathbf{r_1})]$$

The zero-order ground-state wave function and ground-state energy:
$$\Psi_k^{(0)}=\varphi_k(\mathbf{r_1},\mathbf{r_2}) \Omega(\sigma_1,\sigma_2)$$
$$\varphi_0(\mathbf{r_1},\mathbf{r_2})=\psi_{1s}(r_1, heta_1,\varphi_1)\psi_{1s}(r_2, heta_2,\varphi_2)$$
$$\psi_{1s}(\mathbf{r_j})=( rac{Z^3}{\pi a_0^3})^{1/2} e^{-Zr_j/a_0} \qquad j=1,2$$

$$E_{0}^{(0)}=- rac{Z^{2} m_{e} e^{4}}{32 \pi^{2} \varepsilon_{0}^{2} \hbar^{2}}- rac{Z^{2} m_{e} e^{4}}{32 \pi^{2} \varepsilon_{0}^{2} \hbar^{2}} \quad(\mathrm{Z}=2)$$

The first-order energy correction is obtained as:
$$E_{0}^{(1)} =\left\langle\Psi_{0}^{(0)}| u| \Psi_{0}^{(0)} ight angle =\iint d \mathbf{r_1} d \mathbf{r_2} \psi_{1s}\left(\mathbf{r_1} ight) \psi_{1s}\left(\mathbf{r_2} ight) rac{e^{2}}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0} r_{12}} \psi_{1s}\left(\mathbf{r_1} ight) \psi_{1 s}\left(\mathbf{r_2} ight)= rac{5 Z}{8}\left( rac{m_{e} e^{4}}{16 \pi^{2} \varepsilon_{0}^{2} \hbar^{2}} ight)$$

With the first-order perturbation theory, the ground-state energy is (in the units of $\left( rac{m_{e} e^{4}}{16 \pi^{2} \varepsilon_{0}^{2} \hbar^{2}} ight)$):
$$E_0 \approx E_0^{(0)}+E_0^{(1)}=- rac{1}{2}Z^2- rac{1}{2}Z^2+ rac{5}{8}Z \approx -2.8477 \quad (Z=2)$$

The second-order perturbation theory gives: $-2.910$
The higher-order calculation gives: $-2.9037$
The experimental result is: $-2.9033$

Application of Particle in a 1D Box

箱中粒子，势能不为0：
$$V(x)= rac{V_0 x}{a} \qquad 0 \leq x \leq a$$

显然微扰项为：$ u=V_0 x/a$

The zero-order functions and energies are:
$$\psi_n^{(0)}=( rac{2}{a})^{1/2}\sin rac{n\pi x}{a} \qquad E_n^{(0)}= rac{n^2 h^2}{8ma^2}$$

The first-order energy correction is:
$$E_n^{(1)}=\int_0^a \psi_n^{(0)*} ( rac{V_0 x}{a}) \psi_n^{(0)}dx= rac{V_0}{2}$$
Therefore, the first-order energy is:
$$E_n= rac{n^2 h^2}{8ma^2}+ rac{V_0}{2} \qquad n=1,2,3,…$$

entry.title: 倒易点阵和布里渊区
entry.content:
1 Reciprocal Lattice

衍射斑点是晶体倒易点阵的二维投影放大

1.1 Fourier series 傅里叶级数

周期性函数可以变成无穷多项同周期正弦波叠加

$$f(x+2\pi)=f(x)=\frac{a_0}{2}+\sum_{i=1}^\infty(a_ncosnx+b_nsinnx)$$
其中，$a_0=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{-\pi}^\pi f(x)dx$,
$a_n=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{-\pi}^\pi f(x)cosnxdx$,
$b_n=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{-\pi}^\pi f(x)sinnxdx$

由欧拉公式$e^{\pm ix}=cosx\pm isin x$

$$f(x)=\sum_n c_ne^{inx}$$
其中$c_n=\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{-\pi}^\pi f(x)e^{-inx}dx$

更一般的，以周期为n：
$$n(x+a)=n(x)=\sum_p n_pe^{i\frac{2\pi p}{a}x}$$
其中$n_p=\frac{1}{n}\int_{0}^a n(x)e^{-i\frac{2\pi p}{a}x}dx$

1.2 Reciprocal Lattice(space) 倒易点阵

对于一维晶体 ($n(x+a)=n(x)$):

基矢: $\vec{a}=a\vec{i}$，其中$\vec{i}$表示方向矢量
格矢: $\vec{R}=ma\vec{i}=m\vec{a}$

令$\vec{x}=x\vec{i}$ ,$\vec{G}=\frac{2\pi p}{a}\vec{i}$
$$n(x)=\sum_{p}n_pe^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{x}}=\sum_{G}n_G e^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{x}}$$

令：
$$\vec{b}=\frac{2\pi}{a}\vec{i}$$
$$G=\frac{2\pi p}{a}\vec{i}=p\vec{b}$$
在这里，$\vec{G}$由$\vec{b}$线性组合而来，$\vec{b}$可以作为基矢，$\vec{G}$可以作为格矢。这样构建出来的空间称为倒易空间（倒易点阵、波矢空间）

$\vec{G}$称为倒格矢，单位为长度的倒数
$\vec{b}$称为倒易基矢

对于三维空间 ($n(\vec{r}+\vec{R})=n(\vec{r})$):

格矢: $\vec{R}=u_1\vec{a_1}+u_2\vec{a_2}+u_3\vec{a_3}$

$$n(\vec{r})=\sum_{G}n_G e^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{r}}$$
由$n(\vec{r}+\vec{R})=n(\vec{r})$:
$$\sum_{G}n_G e^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{r}}=\sum_{G}n_G e^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{r}} e^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{R}}$$
因此:
$$e^{i\vec{G}\cdot \vec{R}}=1$$
进而:
$$\vec{G}\cdot \vec{R}=2\pi m，m为整数$$

对正空间：$\vec{R}=u_1\vec{a_1}+u_2\vec{a_2}+u_3\vec{a_3}$
对倒易空间：$\vec{G}=v_1\vec{b_1}+v_2\vec{b_2}+v_3\vec{b_3}$

因此：
$$\vec{b_i} \cdot \vec{a_j}=2\pi(i=j),0(i\neq j)$$

$\vec{R}$的端点对应布拉维点阵中的格点，$\vec{G}$的端点对应倒易点阵中的格点，这些倒易点阵也是布拉维点阵
(对应方式： SC-SC FCC-BCC BCC-FCC)

由$\vec{b_1}\bot (\vec{a_2},\vec{a_3})$:
$$\vec{b_1}= c(\vec{a_2}\times\vec{a_3})$$
两边同时左点乘$\vec{c_1}$
$$\vec{c_1}\cdot\vec{b_1}= c\vec{c_1}\cdot(\vec{a_2}\times\vec{a_3})$$
$$2\pi=cv,v为原胞体积$$

因此：
$$\vec{b_1}=\frac{2\pi}{v}\vec{a_2}\times\vec{a_3}$$
$$\vec{b_2}=\frac{2\pi}{v}\vec{a_3}\times\vec{a_1}$$
$$\vec{b_3}=\frac{2\pi}{v}\vec{a_1}\times\vec{a_2}$$

倒易空间的性质

$$\Delta E \Delta t \geq h$$

Chapter 2: The Postulates and General Principles of Quantum Mechanics

Section 1: Wave Functions, Operators and Eigenvalues

Postulate 1: wave function

The state of a quantum-mechanical system is completely specified by a wave function that depends upon the coordinates of all particles in the system.
$$\Psi=\Psi(x_1,y_1,z_1,…,x_n,y_n,z_n,t)$$

Born: For a 3D one-particle system, the quantity $\Psi(x’,y’,z’,t)\Psi^*(x’,y’,z’,t)dxdydz$ is the probability of finding the particle in the infinitesimal volume element $dxdydz$, located at the point$(x’,y’,z’)$ at time $t$

The Wave Function should be Normalized:

$$\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} |\Psi(x,y,z,t)|^2dxdydz = 1$$
For a many-particle system, the total probability of find all the patricle is unity:
$$\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}…\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}|\Psi(\vec{r},t)|^2dx_1dy_1dz_1…dx_ndy_ndz_n = 1$$

$$\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}|\Psi|^2d au=1$$

Other Requirements

  1. The wave function must be single-valued, finite, and quadratically integrable 单值，连续，平方可积
  2. The wave function and ins first derivatives must be continuous 连续可微

The wave function meeting these requirements is said to be well-behaved 品优函数

To every observable in classical mechanics, there corresponds a quantum-mechanical operator算符 that is linear线性 and hermitian厄米

position: $x$ —- $\hat{X}$ —- x

It is difficult to find the eigenfunctions and eigenvalues of the operator, since the spin-orbital interaction term is usually estimated with first-order perturbation theory一阶微扰理论.

entry.title: VASP输出文件
entry.content:
2 输出文件

输出文件主要包括：
CHG,CHGCAR,CONTCAR,DOSCAR,EIGENVAL,IBZKPT,OSZICAR,OUTCAR,REPORT,vasprun.xml,WAVECAR,XDATCAR

本篇内容较长，比较重要的输出文件使用"※ ※"进行了重点标注

2.1 CHG

包含晶格矢量，原子核最表和电荷密度信息。结构优化和分子动力学模拟每十步储存一次

可以在INCAR中通过LCHARGE = .FALSE关闭输出

2.2 CHGCAR

包含最终结构的晶格矢量，原子核坐标和电荷密度信息

可以在INCAR中通过LCHARGE = .FALSE关闭输出

重启vasp计算或者做DOS，能带计算可以从这个文件中读取电荷信息

2.3 ※CONTCAR※

vasp最后输出的结构信息，包括结构信息和每个原子的速度，格式与POSCAR一样，可以直接复制

对于单点能计算，CONTCAR和POSCAR完全一样

对于结构优化，CONTCAR是优化到最后一步的结构

对于分子动力学计算，CONTCAR是最后一步MD外推的结构，并且包含速度和预矫正(predictor-corrector coordinates)信息

无论那种计算，中断后都可以把CONTCAR复制成POSCAR继续计算

2.4 DOSCAR

储存DOS和DOS积分值信息。DOS:density of state态密度

2.5 EIGENVAL

输出本征值信息：轨道能量和电子占据

每个k点分别对应一套

2.6 IBZKPT

vasp自动生成的k电信系，格式与KPOINTS一样，可以直接复制

2.7 ※OSZICAR※和标准输出文件(out.log)

储存电子步迭代收敛和能量信息，简洁明了

标准输出文件多了计算初始化过程中的一些基本信息:

SCF迭代的输出，程序默认使用DAV(blocked Davidson interation scheme阻尼戴维森迭代方法) 取决于INCAR中ALGO = Normal

具体信息：
N：步数;
E：当前能量;
dE：能量差；
d eps：能带能量变化;
rms：（波函数）方均根;
rms(c)：该步和上一步电荷密度差值

最下一行:

1代表离子步的步数
F=体系总能量(包含电子熵entropy)
E0=修正电子熵后的能量(energy(sigma->0):)
dE两个离子步差值（但单点能只有一个点，所以只有一个离子步）

※※读取时要读取最后一个E0能量

2.8 ※OUTCAR※

VASP输出的细节信息
可以在INCAR中NWRITE=0|1|2|3|4控制输出的详细程度(默认2)
建议MD计算时候用1，其他用2

可以根据开始计算时的电子步耗时来大致估算计算所需时间:

一般结构优化，可以接受电子步时间50s以内，MD 10s以内

输出的能量:

总能；通过估算电子熵，把TS从总能中减掉；外推sigma=0时的能量

迭代结束，输出费米能级信息和能带信息

注:这里的E-fermi对应的时HOMO的能量，与实验上的费米能级不一样

最后会打印总结信息，包括收敛情况，耗时和晶胞的应力信息及力在每个原子上的信息，在凝聚态物理中有用:

接下来，原子坐标和各个原子受力的信息：

然后时最终能量：

最后是总结，包括内存消耗和计算时长

2.9 REPORT

分子动力学(MD)的输出信息总结

2.10 vasprun.xml

包含vasp一些输出信息，比如DOS，能带，用p4vasp打开

2.11 WAVECAR

包含波函数信息，是二进制文件

重启vasp计算时从这里读取波函数信息作为初始猜测

可以在INCAR中通过LWAVE = .FALSE关闭输出

2.12 XDATCAR

在结构优化或者MD计算中保存每一步的结构信息

entry.content:
1 输入文件

常用的有这四个INCAR,POSCAR,POTCAR,KPOINTS

所有输入文件介绍网址

1.1 INCAR

‘what to do and how to do it’

1.1.1 SYSTEM

SYSTEM = fcc Si #任务名称
计算任务名字

1.1.2 ISTART

ISTART = 0 #是否读取WAVECAR中的波函数信息

ISTART = 0|1|2|3

默认: ISTART = 1 (if WAVECAR file exists); 0(else)

是否读取波函数（WAVECAR是保存计算波函数文件）：

ISTART = 0:由程序初猜产生

ISTART = 1:从WAVEVCAR读取，如果不存在或者不兼容，则由程序初始猜测产生

ISTART = 2:读取WAVECAR并使用相同集组

ISTART = 3:重启分子动力学计算时使用，同时需要WAVECAR和TMPCAR文件

建议：用ISTART = 1稳妥

1.1.3 ICHARG

ICHARG = 2 #控制如何做电荷密度初猜

ICHARG = 0|1|2|4|10|11|12

默认: ICHARG = 2 (if ISTART=0); 0 (else)

VASP的电荷密度初猜（CHGCAR是保存电荷密度信息的文件）：

ICHARG = 0：从WAVECAR计算电荷信息，如果没有WAVECAR则自动调到ICHARG=2

ICHARG = 1：从CHGCAR读取电荷密度并进行外推，如果不存在CHGCAR，则进行初猜

ICHARG = 2：初猜，通过原子电荷密度叠加产生

ICHARG = 10|11|12：做非自洽计算时使用，电荷密度读取CHGCAR且保持不变，DOS和能带计算时使用

建议：用ICHARG = 1稳妥，除非特殊说明比如做DOS和band structure

1.1.4 ENCUT

ENCUT = 240 #平面波的截断能

默认：ENCUT = POTCAR(赝势文件)给出建议范围的最大值

建议：一般400eV对计算表面足够

1.1.5 ISMEAR SIGMA

ISMEAR = 0 #如何加弥散，处理分数占据的轨道
SIGMA = 0.1 #弥散的展宽[eV]

ISMEAR = -5|-4|-3|-2|-1|0|[整数]>0

SIGMA = [实数]

默认： ISMEAR = 1
SIGMA = 0.2

控制VASP如何处理费米能级附近分数占据轨道，为了快速收敛到积分的精确解

ISMEAR = N(>0)：method of Methfessel-Paxton order N（可能导致负占据）

ISMEAR = 0:Gaussian smearing

ISMEAR = -1: Fermi-Dirac smearing

ISMEAR = -2: 分数占据从WAVECAT或者INCAR中读

ISMEAR = -4: tetrahedron method

ISMEAR = -5: tetrahedron method with Blochl corrections

建议：

金属（没有带隙的体系）：ISMEAR = 1; SIGMA = 0.2绝缘体或者半导体：ISMEAR = 1; SIGMA = 0.05DOS计算（态密度）或高精度计算：ISMEAR = -5; SIGMA可以忽略，也可以不管（VASP会自动略过）分子计算：ISMEAR = 0; SIGMA = 0.01

!!!加弥散会引入电子熵!!!

1.2 KPOINTS

在VASP-5.1.12及以后，KPOINTS可以缺省，K点写在INCAR中。但不建议这样做

KPOINTS越多，包含在计算中的信息越多，计算结果越准确

一般选取高对称点和高对称点间的连线。

每个晶格矢量上都取k点

VASP不会将所有k点都计算，会根据对称性省掉一些点

取点方式：比如一个晶胞a=b=5,c=15，则可以取值3 3 1

对于晶胞常数a和取的k点：

                d区金属：ka~=30                简单金属：ka~=25                半导体：ka~=20                绝缘体：ka~=15                原子分子：1 1 1

k点选取时要进行收敛性测试：增加k点能量也不会差别很大，则已经收敛
